subject: Art & Design
title: Giorgio Armani: The Man Who Softened Power Dressing
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Giorgio Armani: The Man Who Softened Power Dressing.

hook.text: Armani removed the stiff lining from men's blazers. A jacket that moved like fabric, not armor.

buildup.text: In the 1980s, power suits were rigid, padded, and aggressive.

discovery.text: He dressed Richard Gere in American Gigolo (1980).

twist.text: He applied the same philosophy to womenswear: borrowing from menswear to create androgynous elegance.

climax.text: Armani built a $10 billion empire across fashion, home, hotels, and restaurants ‚Äî the most diversified designer brand.

punchline.text: Armani proved that power doesn't need to look hard. It can look easy.

quiz.question: What was revolutionary about Armani's approach to the men's blazer?
options: He removed the stiff lining, creating a relaxed yet authoritative silhouette
He added extra padding for a broader shoulder look
He was the first to make blazers in colors other than black
